page.title: 04Education
page.content: Continued from page 3. The schools in this area also include a secondary school which accepts children in the year they reach eleven year's old. Children have to stay at school until they reach sixteen when they may leave to take up employment or further education or they may stay on, usually for two more years, to undertake further education which may include GCE A levels or other courses of study. The School accepts children from a wide area where their parents have requested that they should attend the John Lea Comprehensive school but most of the children come form the immediate area around the school in Wellingborough and from the villages of Earls Barton and Great Doddington.
